entry.title: Adding New BIP Editors
entry.summary:
The discussion regarding the selection of Core maintainers and BIP editors has revealed a nuanced landscape of considerations, revealing that the process is more complex than initially anticipated. Concerns have been raised about the potential conflicts of interest or the dilution of responsibilities that might arise from individuals holding multiple significant roles within the Bitcoin development ecosystem. For instance, the suggestion that someone actively involved in maintaining critical infrastructure such as LND and btcd, while also being the CTO of Lightning Labs, may not be the best fit for a BIP editor role due to the time and attention these responsibilities demand. This situation underscores the importance of ensuring that roles requiring independence, such as BIP editors and Core maintainers, are not conflated.
Furthermore, there's an acknowledgment of the specialized skills and dedication required to effectively contribute to the Bitcoin Improvement Proposal (BIP) process and Core maintenance. The email highlights that these roles are not merely administrative but require a deep understanding of the technical and community dynamics at play. This recognition is coupled with an appreciation for the contributions of individuals who are deemed capable but currently embroiled in other commitments, suggesting a need for careful consideration of candidates' current workloads and potential conflicts of interest.
Amidst these considerations, the willingness of an individual to volunteer as a BIP editor reflects a proactive approach to addressing the challenges identified in the selection process. By drawing on their experiences and observations of the BIP process, including the frictions and tensions encountered, this person offers to bring a thoughtful perspective to the role, emphasizing the blend of administrative and technical acumen required for effective governance within the Bitcoin ecosystem.
